key_risks: Vision Fund's significant losses and underperforming investments
High debt levels and reliance on asset sales for liquidity
Regulatory scrutiny and failed ARM-NVIDIA deal
Governance concerns due to centralized decision-making
controversies: WeWork investment debacle and legal disputes
Vision Fund's poor performance and write-downs
governance_issues: Lack of transparency in investment strategies
Centralized decision-making by founder Masayoshi Son

sources.title: SoftBank's First Vision Fund May Be Its Last After $18 Billion Loss
sources.snippet: SoftBank Group Corp. said Monday the Vision Fund lost $17.7 billion in the most recent fiscal year, triggering the worst loss ever in the Japanese company's 39-year history. SoftBank had to write down the valuations of companies like WeWork and Uber Technologies Inc. because of business missteps and the coronavirus fallout. Its return on the fund is negative 6%, compared with 62% just a year ...

sources.title: SoftBank Faces Big Losses from Vision Fund Investments
sources.snippet: SoftBank Group Corp has recently released its second-quarter earnings report for the fiscal year 2024. The report highlights significant losses primarily attributed to its Vision Fund investment arm. This situation has raised concerns among investors and analysts alike. SoftBank's CEO, Masayoshi Son, addressed the challenges faced by the company.
